cloudCoding

Class Console

  • java.lang.Object
    • cloudCoding.Console

  • public class Console
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton object used to execute arbitrary code as requested from the client. This class is responsible for creating and storing UserProcess objects for static access to them from anywhere in the system. The class is also responsible for setting up the sandbox in which client code is executed.
    Author:
    Alex Brandt

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Console getInstance()
        Get a reference to a Console object for creating UserProcesses
        Returns:
        a reference to a Console object

      • getProcess

        public UserProcess getProcess(long processID)
        Gets a process by its unique ID. This will return the process regardless if it has already stopped. If no process with such a processID exists, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        processID - the unique ID of the user process
        Returns:
        the associated UserProcess, or null if no such process.

      • processEnded

        public void processEnded(long processID)
        Notify that a process has ended.
        Parameters:
        processID - the ID of the ended process.

      • execute

        public UserProcess execute(java.io.File file,
                           java.lang.String command)
        Execute the given command and command arguments using file as the working directory. Returns a UserProcess object which encapsulates the execution thread of the process. The working directory should be the root directory which the requesting user can access. For example: The user ab1637 should only access /static/users/ab1637/ as that user's "root" directory.
        Parameters:
        file - a file object representing the working directory.
        command - a string containing the command and arguments to execute
        Returns:
        a UserProcess encapsulating the execution thread
